intro: Eriocaulon vaupesense, commonly known as the Vaupes sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in the Amazon Basin and surrounding regions. The plant typically grows in wetland and swampy areas, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Eriocaulon vaupesense plays a role in maintaining the ecological balance of its habitat by providing shelter and food for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
